comment_data.body:
This is my XML Output:
```
tx  <stream:features>
tx    <receipt_acks></receipt_acks>
tx    <status></status>
tx  </stream:features>

▒▒o▒B.T▒(▒▒VQ▒▒~▒▒J_▒:xmpp-sasl">.▒]▒.c`▒8\▒'▒g</challenge>
tx  <auth xmlns="urn:ietf:params:xml:ns:xmpp-sasl" mechanism="WAUTH-1" user="49176xxxxxxxxxx">▒E▒{}▒o
tx  <presence type="available" name="XXXXXXXXXX"></presence>
```

Yes. Thats weird. Why you keep connect and disxonnect all the time. Even
official client not working that way. When screen off. It just send
unavailable status.

sent using android mobiles
On Aug 19, 2013 7:22 PM, "Max Kovaljov" <notifications@github.com> wrote:

> Is there a particular reason why you would reconnect every time rather
> than keeping the same connection open and using a loop which calls
> pollMessages()?
>
> while(true){
>     $w->pollMessages();
>     sleep(1);}
>
> —
> Reply to this email directly or view it on GitHub<https://github.com/venomous0x/WhatsAPI/issues/442#issuecomment-22867846>
> .
>

@antonella18 , the official clients disconnects and reconnects very frequently (the server will stop responding after five minutes of receiving packet inactivity). The heartbeat system (ping, pong) doesn't exist anymore. It's been dead for almost a month now. It's now the client's duty to keep the connection well and active =)

Hm, what assegaf and Dynogic are saying is quite contradicting... 
Actually I still see ping-pongs from the script which seem to be working. 

To understand what I am doing: I have a php script which sends and receives messages in a endless while loop.
As long as I dont't disconnect and reconnect in the script, it seems to be running forever without a problem.
So now I let the script end after 2 days (after disconnect) and then restart it after 30 seconds - this is working.

@antonella18 haven't received any ping yet, it's like Dynogic says.

btw: Sounds like a spam script ?.

What on earth gave you the impression I am running a spam script? This is really paranoid. 
My script is sending messages - if there is a message to be sent - and receiving messages - if there is a message to be received. Any problem with that?
@Dynogic I'm not constantly sending messages, there are often several hours between one message and the next.

Thank you all for your help though.

```I have a php script which sends and receives messages in a endless while loop.```
That part gave me the impression ;)
@Dynogic Well, maybe I'm too naive about what people are using WhatsAPI for...

title: How to disconnect and reconnect/login?
